00020 #ifndef _RTAI_NUCLEUS_PIPE_H
00021 #define _RTAI_NUCLEUS_PIPE_H
00022 
00023 #include <nucleus/queue.h>
00024 
00025 #define XNPIPE_WAIT   0x0
00026 #define XNPIPE_NOWAIT 0x1
00027 
00028 #define XNPIPE_NORMAL 0x0
00029 #define XNPIPE_URGENT 0x1
00030 
00031 #define XNPIPE_NDEVS      CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_PIPE_NRDEV
00032 #define XNPIPE_DEV_MAJOR  150
00033 
00034 #define XNPIPE_KERN_CONN   0x1
00035 #define XNPIPE_USER_CONN   0x2
00036 #define XNPIPE_USER_WOPEN  0x4
00037 #define XNPIPE_USER_WSEND  0x8
00038 #define XNPIPE_USER_WPOLL  0x10
00039 #define XNPIPE_USER_SIGIO  0x20
00040 #define XNPIPE_USER_ONWAIT 0x40
00041 
00042 #define XNPIPE_USER_WMASK \
00043 (XNPIPE_USER_WOPEN|XNPIPE_USER_WSEND|XNPIPE_USER_WPOLL)
00044 
00045 typedef struct xnpipe_mh {
00046 
00047     xnholder_t link;
00048     unsigned size;
00049     
00050 } xnpipe_mh_t;
00051 
00052 static inline xnpipe_mh_t *link2mh (xnholder_t *laddr)
00053 {
00054     return laddr ? ((xnpipe_mh_t *)(((char *)laddr) - (int)(&((xnpipe_mh_t *)0)->link))) : 0;
00055 }
00056 
00057 #ifdef __KERNEL__
00058 
00059 #include <nucleus/synch.h>
00060 #include <nucleus/thread.h>
00061 #include <linux/types.h>
00062 #include <linux/poll.h>
00063 
00064 typedef int xnpipe_io_handler(int minor,
00065                                 struct xnpipe_mh *mh,
00066                                 int onerror,
00067                                 void *cookie);
00068 
00069 typedef int xnpipe_session_handler(int minor,
00070                                      void *cookie);
00071 
00072 typedef void *xnpipe_alloc_handler(int minor,
00073                                      size_t size,
00074                                      void *cookie);
00075 typedef struct xnpipe_state {
00076 
00077     xnholder_t slink;   /* Link on sleep queue */
00078     xnholder_t alink;   /* Link on async queue */
00079 #define link2xnpipe(laddr,link) \
00080 ((struct xnpipe_state *)(((char *)laddr) - (int)(&((struct xnpipe_state *)0)->link)))
00081 
00082     xnqueue_t inq;      /* From user-space to kernel */
00083     xnqueue_t outq;     /* From kernel to user-space */
00084     xnpipe_io_handler *output_handler;
00085     xnpipe_io_handler *input_handler;
00086     xnpipe_alloc_handler *alloc_handler;
00087     xnsynch_t synchbase;
00088     void *cookie;
00089 
00090     /* Linux kernel part */
00091     xnflags_t status;
00092     struct linux_semaphore open_sem;
00093     struct linux_semaphore send_sem;
00094     struct linux_semaphore *wchan;      /* any sem */
00095     struct fasync_struct *asyncq;
00096     wait_queue_head_t pollq;
00097 
00098 } xnpipe_state_t;
00099 
00100 extern xnpipe_state_t xnpipe_states[];
00101 
00102 #define xnminor_from_state(s) (s - xnpipe_states)
00103

00110 void xnpipe_umount(void);

00115                   xnpipe_session_handler *close_handler);

00118                    xnpipe_io_handler *output_handler,
00119                    xnpipe_io_handler *input_handler,
00120                    xnpipe_alloc_handler *alloc_handler,
00121                    void *cookie);

00128                     int flags);

00131                     struct xnpipe_mh **pmh,

00136 #ifdef __cplusplus

00140 static inline xnholder_t *xnpipe_m_link(xnpipe_mh_t *mh) {
00141     return &mh->link;
00142 }
00143 
00144 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00145 
00146 static inline char *xnpipe_m_data(xnpipe_mh_t *mh) {
00147     return (char *)(mh + 1);
00148 }
00149 
00150 #define xnpipe_m_size(mh) ((mh)->size)
